trans-unit.source: Represents a channel that is used to send WS-Trust messages to a security token service (STS).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannelFactory"></xref> that is creating the channel.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustChannelContract"></xref> the channel will use to send and receive <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> objects.
The version of WS-Trust the channel will use for serializing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> objects.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> the channel will use for serializing WS-Trust messages.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer"></xref> the channel will use for serializing WS-Trust request messages.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer"></xref> the channel will use for serializing WS-Trust response messages.
Causes a communication object to transition immediately from its current state into the closed state.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Cancel message to an endpoint using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous cancel operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous cancel operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous cancel operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Cancel message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous cancel operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous cancel operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous cancel operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous close operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to close a communication object with a specified timeout.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies how long the close operation has to complete before timing out.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous close operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Issue message to an endpoint using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous issue operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous issue operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous issue operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Issue message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous issue operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous issue operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous issue operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous open operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to open a communication object within a specified interval of time.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies how long the open operation has to complete before timing out.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous close operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous close operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous open operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Renew message to an endpoint using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous renew operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous renew operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous renew operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Renew message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous renew operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous renew operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous renew operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Validate message to an endpoint using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous validate operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous validate operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous validate operation.
Begins an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Validate message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.AsyncCallback> delegate that receives notification of the completion of the asynchronous validate operation.
An object, specified by the application, that contains state information associated with the asynchronous validate operation.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that references the asynchronous validate operation.
Sends a WS-Trust Cancel message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.
Sends a WS-Trust Cancel message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.
Gets or sets the channel object that is used for sending and receiving messages.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel> object that is used for sending and receiving <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> objects.
Gets or sets the factory that created the channel.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannelFactory"></xref> that created the channel object.
Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state.
Causes a communication object to transition from its current state into the closed state within a specified interval of time.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies how long the open operation has to complete before timing out.
Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the closing state into the closed state.
To be added.
Occurs when the communication object first enters the closing state.
To be added.
Gets or sets the channel contract the channel uses for sending and receiving messages.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.IWSTrustChannelContract"></xref> that defines the channel contract.
Creates a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object that represents a WS-Trust RST message.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> to serialize into the message.
The type of WS-Trust request to serialize.
This parameter must be one of the string constants in <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestTypes"></xref>.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object that represents the WS-Trust message.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Cancel message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginCancel%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Cancel message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginCancel%28System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.
Completes an asynchronous operation to close a communication object.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that is returned by a call to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginClose*> method.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Issue message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginIssue%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Issue message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginIssue%28System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
A reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the token issued by the STS.
Completes an asynchronous operation to open a communication object.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> that is returned by a call to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginOpen*> method.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Renew message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginRenew%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Renew message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginRenew%28System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
A reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Validate message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginValidate%28System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IAsyncResult> reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.

Completes an asynchronous operation to send a WS-Trust Validate message initiated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.BeginValidate%28System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken%2CSystem.AsyncCallback%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
A reference to the outstanding asynchronous send request.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.
Occurs when the communication object first enters the faulted state.
To be added.
To be added.
Gets the WS-Addressing SOAP action that corresponds to the specified request type and WS-Trust version.
The type of WS-Trust request.
This parameter must be one of the string constants in the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestTypes"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.WSTrustChannel.TrustVersion*> of the request.
A string that contains the URI that represents the WS-Addressing action.
Gets the security token from the RSTR.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request used to ask for the security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> that represents the response containing the security token.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the parsed security token.
response is .
Sends a WS-Trust Issue message to an endpoint STS using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the token issued by the STS.
Sends a WS-Trust Issue message to an endpoint STS using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.

Sends a WS-Trust Issue message to an endpoint STS using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> and <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> objects.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> that represents the response from the STS.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityToken"></xref> that represents the token issued by the STS.
Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state.
Causes a communication object to transition from the created state into the opened state within a specified interval of time.
The <xref:System.TimeSpan> that specifies how long the open operation has to complete before timing out.
Occurs when the communication object completes its transition from the opening state into the opened state.
To be added.
Occurs when the communication object first enters the opening state.
To be added.
Deserializes a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> from a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> received from the WS-Trust endpoint.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> received from the WS-Trust endpoint.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> deserialized from the response.
Sends a WS-Trust Renew message to an endpoint using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.
Sends a WS-Trust Renew message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.
Gets the current state of the communication-oriented object.
The set accessor is protected.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.CommunicationState> that represents the current state of the channel.
Gets or sets the version of WS-Trust this channel uses for serializing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> objects.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.TrustVersion> (URI) used by the channel.
Sends a WS-Trust Validate message to an endpoint using the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> that represents the request to the STS.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> representing the STS response.
Sends a WS-Trust Validate message to an endpoint using the specified <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> object.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> that contains the instructions for the request to the STS.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> returned from the STS.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer"></xref> that the channel uses for serializing WS-Trust request messages.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustRequestSerializer"></xref> used by the channel.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer"></xref> that the channel uses for serializing WS-Trust response messages.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer"></xref> used by the channel.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that the channel uses for serializing WS-Trust messages.
The set accessor is protected.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> used by the channel.
